text: Your Monday Evening BriefingHere’s what you need to know at the end of the day.
The Modern Love PodcastWelcome to the new season.
The Book Review PodcastDavid Nasaw and Carlos Lozada discuss their new books.

Dueling Views of Barrett in Supreme Court Confirmation FightA confirmation process likely to steer the court to the right for years began with Democrats and Republicans seeking to define Judge Amy Coney Barrett.Democrats portrayed her as a conservative who would target the Affordable Care Act and abortion rights. Republicans promoted her sterling qualifications.
Showtime in a Potential Petri DishThe hearing was not so much a deliberation as it was a media spectacle convened amid potentially lethal virus particles, our correspondent writes in a memo.

As Trump Flouts Safety Protocols, News Outlets Balk at Close CoverageOn the way to his rally in Florida, President Trump boarded Air Force One — where reporters were seated in the cabin — without wearing a mask.
Some Democrats in Trump country aren’t shy anymore about liking Joe Biden.

Trump Funnels Record Subsidies to Farmers Ahead of Election DayFederal payments to farmers are projected to hit a record $46 billion this year, but America’s agriculture sector remains under severe economic pressure.

Daily Distortions: On Facebook, Misinformation Is More Popular NowPeople are engaging more on Facebook with news outlets that publish misinformation than they did before the 2016 election, new research found.
Michelle Macario, a community college student in Los Angeles, watched a friend’s dog in exchange for a place to stay for a week. Christian Monterrosa for The New York Times
There’s Cause for Optimism, Even as the Pandemic RagesThe months ahead will be difficult. But the medical cavalry is coming, and the rest of us know what we need to do, writes Donald G. McNeil Jr.
Jeffrey Epstein and Leon Black with the sugar-cane magnate José Fanjul at a movie screening in 2005. Joe Schildhorn/Patrick McMullan, via Getty Images
